Description: Rim and body sherd, with handle root (mended from three fragments), of North Ionian pottery rosette or lotus bowl; glaze fired orange-red throughout; interior: glazed with traces of two bands in added white (one below rim and second near bottom of sherd); exterior: set of six debased rays flank handle; central motif of lip frieze lost; broad band below lip zone; a broad diagonal band runs from below handle to break at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Written in pencil on interior: NA 5A.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.818)
